title: Part A
stimulusHtml:

Two points for describing two separate differences in the cultural landscape of both images’ pilgrimage locations.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that Islam spread to different locations as Muslims moved from its hearth.

Two points for explaining how Islam was able to spread through relocation diffusion.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the spread of Islam from its culture hearth is an example of relocation diffusion:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating the difference in the global spatial pattern of Hinduism and Buddhism.

Two points for explaining how the global spatial patterns differ between Hinduism and Buddhism.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the global spatial pattern of Hinduism differs from the global spatial pattern of universalizing religions such as Buddhism:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that migrants may introduce new cultural traits to the location shown in Image 2.

Two points for explaining how patterns of migration affect the culture in Image 2 through multiculturalism or differing social and political views.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that a centrifugal force can increase political/cultural divisions in Jerusalem.

Two points for explaining the degree to which a centrifugal force can cause a division in the location in Image 1.
